results.title: Spain: a Catalonian menu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
People who live in areas with large Latin communities may be familiar with Spanish cooking. But the charming chef Carlos Sentis adds his personal touch and keen insights to the food of northern Spain. Includes the preparation of such Catalonian specialties as Sapa de Pescado and Chicken and Lobster Subur style.

results.title: The Watchkeepers
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Satellite technology combined with computer graphics can present an enormous range of information about Spaceship Earth and its inhabitants. This information can be climatic, demographic, geographic, religious, horticultural, agricultural and social. This program reviews the range of information accessible via these combined technologies and with the help of the NASA computer examines the first “living portrait” of the earth.

results.title: Running water
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Managing the rivers will be an important part of managing global climate changes. Using satellite technologies, this program visits the great river basins of the planet - the Nile, Amazon, Mississippi, Ganges, Danube and the Yellow River. These mighty watercourses have a profound influence on the people who conduct their daily life along their banks.

results.title: The Swirling seas
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
It’s hopeful that views from space can help human beings to better understand the oceans, and to care for them more wisely than has happened with land resources. Satellites have transformed the human view of the world’s oceans and coastal seas. Maps which took centuries of seagoing observations to compile are now being superceded by a constant stream of space data.

results.title: The New global geography
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
In conjunction with modern computing power, space technology is helping scientists to create global geography. The aim is to discover how Spaceship Earth’s life-support system really works, and how natural and human forces are changing it. Satellites help us to understand our planet, particularly in monitoring global weather patterns which can shift rapidly.

results.title: A Global market
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
The complex economic activities performed by humans takes on a new perspective when viewed from space with remote sensors. Important questions are posed. How does mining interfere with the lives of local inhabitants? Can the Earth really support its population? A global image illustrates how all the continents of the planet are linked by trade and shipping routes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television

results.title: Disappearing forests
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
People have cleared forests for dwellings, firewood and farming. Can human needs in such areas be weighed against the needs of the planet and its survival? Satellite images worldwide show forest fires and forest clearance, revealing the extent of forest destruction. The program explores the impact of this on the Earth and on the native peoples who live in affected regions.

results.title: The Air-conditioning
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
The problem of global warming has preoccupied scientists, meteorologists and environmentalists since it was considered a threat to our existence. Artificial satellites have helped provide a clearer picture. However, if more reliable forecasting shows that some countries can expect to benefit from the warming of the planet, will those countries want to prevent human impact on the climate of Spaceship Earth?
